titleStmt.title: The ansvver to the London lasses folly: or, The new-found father discoverd at the camp. You maidens that are kind and free, I plainly must confess; be careful of virginity, 'twill be your happiness. Tune is, The journey-man shooe-maker. This may be printed, R.L.S.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for C. Dennisson, at the Stati[oners] Arms within Aldgate.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "You maidens wild, that were beguil'd ..."
Imperfect: cropped at edge affecting text and imprint.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
